metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5732 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the partition-range implementation in templates/table/structure/display_partitions.phtml in the table-structure page in phpMyAdmin 4.6.x before 4.6.3 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted table parameters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
